identificationModule.briefTitle: Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement With the Medtronic Intrepid™ TMVR System in Patients With Severe Symptomatic Mitral Regurgitation.
identificationModule.officialTitle: Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement With the Medtronic Intrepid™ TMVR System in Patients With Severe Symptomatic Mitral Regurgitation - APOLLO Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Multi-center, global, prospective, non-randomized, interventional, pre-market trial. All subjects enrolled with receive the study device.

armGroups.label: Primary Cohort- TMVR
armGroups.description: Treatment of mitral regurgitation with the Medtronic Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement System (TMVR)
interventionNames: Device: Medtronic Intrepid Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement System (TMVR)

armGroups.label: Mitral Annular Calcification -TMVR
armGroups.description: Treatment of mitral regurgitation with the Medtronic Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement System (TMVR)
interventionNames: Device: Medtronic Intrepid Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement System (TMVR)

interventions.name: Medtronic Intrepid Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement System (TMVR)
Medtronic Intrepid Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement System (TMVR)
interventions.description: Medtronic Intrepid Transcatheter Mitral Valve Replacement System (TMVR) mitral valve replacement

primaryOutcomes.description: The rate of all-cause mortality or heart failure hospitalization

secondaryOutcomes.measure: all-cause mortality, disabling stroke, acute kidney injury, prolonged ventilation, deep wound infection, reoperation or reintervention, and major bleeding
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days or hospital discharge (whichever is later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in New York Heart Association Class
Echocardiographic assessments of degree mitral valve regurgitation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Moderate to severe or severe symptomatic mitral regurgitation
* Local site multidisciplinary heart team experienced in mitral valve therapies agrees that the subject is unsuitable for treatment with approved transcatheter repair or conventional mitral valve intervention

Exclusion Criteria:

* prior transcatheter mitral valve procedure with device currently implanted
* anatomic contraindications
* prohibitive mitral annular calcification
* left ventricular ejection fraction \<25%
* need for emergent or urgent surgery
* hemodynamic instability
